class_notes:
Sculpture 209 is a course designed to build upon the conceptual foundations and technical skills developed in Sculpture 109. Students will be expected to delve deeper into the conceptual and formal motivations of contemporary sculpture. The course will explore Installation, Sound, Video, and multi-media/intermedia approaches to artmaking. This class will introduce students to upper-level fabrication techniques as well as many of the computer programs that contemporary artists employ including open source video and sound editing software. 
Prerequisite: ARTVIS 109 or approval of the professor. Contact Prof. Haugaard with request: dana.haugaard@emory.edu and cc: laurie.carter@emory.edu
course_description: Contemporary sculptural practice is emphasized in both practical and theoretical terms. Students will continue to investigate the relationship of ideas to materials and construction techniques.
prerequisites: This course requires ARTVIS 109 or equivalent transfer credit as a prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: This section is full 3692, Section #: 1, Type: ART, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 2:40-3:55p, Instructor: D. Haugaard, Status: Closed
